answers.answer: You should call your doctor right away. This could be a bad sign, and it's better to be safe than sorry. I have heard somewhere too that itchy skin can be a sign of something too. Sorry I don't remember what it was though
My little guy is very quiet some days and crazy busy others.  If you have a gut feeling that something is different, then call your doctor.  It's not worth the worry.

Less movement along with really itchy skin would cause me some concern. My cousin went to the hospital 2 months ago because she couldnt sleep due to her itching so bad. She went to the ER to find out that she had SEVERE preeclampsia and they had to take the baby via c-section at 31 weeks preggo. Baby is now home but did have to be in the NICU for 4 weeks.Better to be safe than sorry. Get checked out hun.

I actually went to L&D on Friday due to lack of movement. I was only there for about an hour, cause when they hooked me up to the monitors my little guy started going CRAZY lol! But they told me that we did the right thing by coming in... they said most of the time its just a lazy baby, but every once in a while it can be something more and if you come in they are able to intervene. As far as the itching, I have no clue, I know there are several things that can cause itching in pregnacy... is there a rash?? I know that PUPPS is a pregnancy rash that can itch like crazy but doesnt harm the baby, and then as Lance06 said... preelcampsia is also a more serious possiblitiy. It is always better to at least call your Dr when in doubt. Good Luck hun!

question: please can some one tell me is it normal to have a lazy baby my baby dont move that much and imstarting to worry im 31 weeks and through the whole pregnancy she wasnt that actove but i felt her morenow i hardly feel her move also i have itchy skin that drives me mad iv had it for a while now would this havsomethin to do with her not moving much???
title: dont feel baby move much
